radiographic_examinations.procedure_name: Anteroposterior radiograph of the right hip
radiographic_examinations.findings: Ill-defined lesion in the right ilium; no soft-tissue swelling, masses, or fractures noted.
Ill-defined lytic lesion of the right ilium; no acute osseous injury.

radiographic_examinations.procedure_name: Magnetic resonance imaging scan of the abdomen and pelvis
radiographic_examinations.findings: Multiple lytic lesions noted within the ischium, both femoral necks, and both ilia. The largest lesion of the right ilium extended into the iliacus and gluteal musculature.
Decrease in the size of the lesions and development of sclerotic-appearing bone within them.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: Healing of the lesion in the right ilium with a marked cortical response.
